body: +1 The code change is ok to me
Changes has been merged to master
For PBE query, snapshot is set int PortalRunUtility(), so other changes also cause issues.

```
Because data locality and hdfs metadata cache will fetch pg_aoseg meta data when planning, we need to re-fetch the latest snapshot.
```

That's right, but all plannable statements have already got the snapshot. Did we missing something?
It is the issue of order of locking and getting snapshot. After unlocking, snapshot become outdated and should renew.
+1 The code change is ok to me.

Good fix.  
BTW, if we can auto detect it in recovery mode, then wait until it finished, instead of hard code to sleep 5 minutes, it would be much better in case of some scenario that the recovery may take more than 5 seconds to finish.

Good suggestion, to accomplish this, we need to do  more investigation to standby recovery process, so we can know how long it will require for different cases and what's the way to check if standby is in recovery mode. Will have another Jira to trace this. Thanks.

In fact when executing one normal statement(SELECT/INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE), the snapshot will be fetched several times, at previous version, we fetched one snapshot before transform query, and re-fetched one at the beginning of query execution. 

Your last comments above is exactly the root cause of this defect. ~_~
looks there are still other places that call pg_plan_queries, why don't we re-fetch the snapshot?

Yes, only 2 functions:
- _SPI_prepare_plan():  you can find that before calling pg_plan_queries(), it already fetch a new snapshot. And between them, it just some simple code, which is impossible to lock. So we don't need to re-fetch one.  
- exec_parse_message(): From the comment in the code, it just called for syntax check.
               /**
       \* Even though we do not store the plan, we want to perform planning
       \* to know if SQL syntax is supported.
       */

Looks good. Thanks, Roman.
I am modifying pom.xml to add "PostgreSQL license" according to your suggestion.
Let me know when this gets merged in. I've got another PR to take care of the rest of licensing concerns.

Roman, would you like to merge this pull request into master? So that, I can modify pom.xml(add postgresql license and modify exclude list) based on this code change.
Thanks!

Roman, a new version of pom.xml has been pushed into master.
After your checkin, I will re-run mvc apache rat check and handle those new unknown files.

LGTM.
It's great to have a new hawqarray, we can enable more and more functions in hawqarray in the future..
+1 The change is ok to me.

The patch is generally OK but I have some concerns.

1) Do we have test case for CRC calculation?
2) By default the checksum verify for interconnect module is disable, but we do not have test case for CRC enable interconnect. It make code change unsafe.

checked with @rvs , we should put "Apache HAWQ incubating" in the vendor column for now.
If we graduate to become a top project of Apache, we may use "ASF" in the column.
Look good except that it does not have a JIRA number related to this.
+1 The code change is ok to me.
nice @cbaenziger!  does it fully build on Ubunutu?  Were you able to run any tests with the system started?

Hi @ivannovick it seems to fully build and pass unit-tests. I was looking for some ideas on packaging to add in RPM and DEB build support; then I can try some tests on a [Chef-BACH](https://github.com/bloomberg/chef-bach) cluster.

It's probably best to point to my Chef process for testing. (It ensured CentOS still built and Ubuntu was building.) I ran the following for:
- libhdfs3: https://github.com/cbaenziger/incubator-hawq/blob/test_kitchen/chef/hawq_build/recipes/libhdfs3.rb 
- libyarn: https://github.com/cbaenziger/incubator-hawq/blob/test_kitchen/chef/hawq_build/recipes/libyarn.rb
- HAWQ: https://github.com/cbaenziger/incubator-hawq/blob/test_kitchen/chef/hawq_build/recipes/hawq.rb

I see libyarn's tests were commented out for some reason. I'll add the failure for discussion on the HAWQ-307 JIRA; rebuilding now.
@changleicn can you give some pointers on what basic set of tests can be run to verify the build?
@changleicn ah! Good point about the JIRA. Sorry about not filing one -- will keep that in mind.
Darn! Looks like my header injection script got tripped up for some reason :-(
Please see here for the tests used for validation: https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=61320026

@hsyuan helped me work out a workaround on OSX.

If you are using OSX, this is a quick workaround we tried to get it working again:

```
brew install postgresql
sudo easy_install pip
sudo pip --retries=50 --timeout=300 install pg8000 simplejson unittest2 pycrypto pygresql pyyaml lockfile paramiko psi
sudo pip --retries=50 --timeout=300 install http://darcs.idyll.org/~t/projects/figleaf-0.6.1.tar.gz
sudo pip --retries=50 --timeout=300 install http://sourceforge.net/projects/pychecker/files/pychecker/0.8.19/pychecker-0.8.19.tar.gz/download
```

Also, update the **greenplum_path.sh** to remove the **$GPHOME/ext/python/bin** so that default python can be used instead of the one come with hawq.

@radarwave since we no-longer depends on the python came with HAWQ, shall we just remote the **$GPHOME/ext/python**?
Will this fix work also for rehl? I thought it was needed in order to make sure we run with the right version of python.

Good question, and I am sorry I don't have resource to test that scenario. I rely on the build automation on all different flavor of OSs to pass.

All the fix is to 'remove' the lingering python references in the Makefiles, so that if we build on OSX, we can have proper reference of the python pre-installed on the box, other than the one comes with the HAWQ.

Again, the build process should now able to install all the python dependencies before the build. Actually, those should be factored in as part of 'configure' on the 'apache-hawq' part.
In that case, should we also remove the reference to python in the DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH?
Yes good catch. I removed, and test it works. Thanks.
It seems the faults in faultinjector.c need to be reorganized. So I close the pull request and want to make a clean up.
@hornn can you please merge this PR?
